marklogic.body: This is heart felt right here, Maestro was a good man, I remember recording back at his old Spot post oak, ridge area (I think) back when Klondike Kat and K-Rino were first poppin , I was doing Hip Hop shit then and surprised him with my Philly Connects, since he was PHILLY Bred... though I lost track with him after 98 or so, I admired his mentoring and insight, we used to go late nights, one night we just jammed on some beats and rhymes and he even played the wind jammer on a track I did... he was stand up, OFFICIAL and judging by the looks of it, Chane, You on the right track dogg, It killed me to see that footage as my father went through the same ordeal, but luckily got a kidney donated from my girl, I Always saluted Stro, and I salute you now... This is heavy, hold your head and keep making musick! - ZILLA
